solution_line_template: In Dana's senior class, the {female_percent_num}% of {total_students} students is {female_percent_decimal}*{total_students}=<<{female_percent_decimal}*{total_students}={num_female_students}>>{num_female_students} female students.

Fifty percent of the females, or {brunette_female_percent_decimal}*{num_female_students}=<<{brunette_female_percent_decimal}*{num_female_students}={num_female_brunettes}>>{num_female_brunettes} of the female students were brunettes.

If {under_5_feet_percent_num}% of the female brunettes were under 5 feet tall, then there were {num_female_brunettes}*{under_5_feet_percent_decimal}=<<{under_5_feet_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{num_female_brunettes}={num_female_brunettes_under_5_feet}>>{num_female_brunettes_under_5_feet} female brunettes under five feet tall in Dana's senior class.
